Column Comment.0: UNIQUE WELL IDENTIFIER: A unique name, code or number designated as theprimary key for this row.
Column Comment.1: WELL DRILLING PERIOD OBSERVATION NUMBER: unique identifier for areporting period for well operations. Internationally, there may be 1, 2 or 3 periodseach 24 hours. In some jurisdictions, reporting may occur for more than one period,such as for an 8 hour tour shift and a 24 daily summary.
Column Comment.2: SUPPORT FACILITY SUBTYPE: check constraint value that is used to maintain therelationship between SUPPORT FACILITY and its various sub-types.
Column Comment.3: VESSEL IDENTIFIER: Unique identifier for the marine vessel.
Column Comment.4: ACTIVE INDICATOR: A Y/N flag indicating whether this row of data is currently eitheractive / valid (Y) or inactive / invalid (N).
Column Comment.5: EFFECTIVE DATE: The date that the data in this row first came into effect.
Column Comment.6: EXPIRY DATE: The date that the data in this row was no longer active or in effect.
Column Comment.7: HEADING: The direction in degrees that the vessel is headed.
Column Comment.8: HEADING DIRECTION NORTH TYPE: Valid north references used in surveying todefine angular measurements. For example, True North, Magnetic North, Grid North,Astronomical North, ...
Column Comment.9: PASSENGERS UNBOARDED (OFF): The number of passengers who debarked orleft the vessel during this period.
Column Comment.10: PASSENGERS BOARDED ON: Number of passengers that boarded the vesselduring this period.,
Column Comment.11: ROW_MANAGEMENT_GUID: This value may be used to provide a global uniqueidentifier for this row of data. Use of this column is not mandatory, but if used,optional PPDM NOT NULL and UNIQUE INDEX constraints provided in the datamodel DDL should be created.
Column Comment.12: REMARK: Narrative remarks relating to this row of data.
Column Comment.13: RISER ANGLE: The angle between the riser and the vessel during this shift. If morefrequent measures are needed, use WELL DRILL STATISTIC
Column Comment.14: RISER TENSION: The riser is a casing that runs from the ship to the top of the blowpreventors on the sea floor. If the ship has to move off site, it only has to disconnectthe riser from the blow preventors, and leave the pipe in the hole before they leave.Pressure is not managed in the riser, but simply allows fluid flow between the blowpreventors and the rig. This value measures the tension on the riser during theperiod. If more frequent measures are desired, use WELL DRILL STATISTIC.
Column Comment.15: RISER TENSION ORIGINAL UNIT OF MEASURE
Column Comment.17: SOURCE: The individual, company, state, or government agency designated as thesource of information for this row.
Column Comment.18: VESSEL ROLE: The specific role played by a vessel during an operation, such asseismic source creation, drilling, cleanup, supplies transportation, personelletransportation etc.
Column Comment.19: ROW CHANGED BY: Application login id of the user who last changed the row.
Column Comment.20: ROW CHANGED DATE: System date of the last time the row was changed.
Column Comment.21: ROW CREATED BY: System user who created this row of data.
Column Comment.22: ROW CREATED DATE: Date that the row was created on.
Column Comment.23: ROW_EFFECTIVE_DATE: A system assigned date that specified when a row of datais effective from a systems perspective. This may be the date that a row of data wasmade available to end users, for example.
Column Comment.24: ROW_EXPIRY_DATE: A system assigned date that specified when a row of data isno longer effective from a systems perspective. This may be the date that a row ofdata was no longer available to end users, for example.
Column Comment.25: PPDM ROW QUALITY: A set of values indicating the quality of data in this row,usually with reference to the method or procedures used to load the data, althoughother types of quality reference are permitted.
